DOC.brief_summary: This study aim compare patient use satisfaction community pharmacist-delivered pharmacogenetic ( PGx ) test deliver along part medication therapy management ( MTM ) service . Pharmacist patient outcome measure collect survey , interview , review pharmacy record .
DOC.brief_title: Delivery Pharmacogenetic Testing Community Pharmacy Setting
DOC.detailed_description: This study aim investigate delivery pharmacogenetic ( PGx ) test alone combination Medication Therapy Management ( MTM ) community pharmacy set order ass compare two delivery model . Using clust randomize trial , effect two model compare . Pharmacist patient outcome measure collect survey , interview , review pharmacy record . The investigator intend compare effect PGx alone PGx MTM pharmacy perspective ( assess impact workflow/operations ) patient perspective ( assess acceptance testing , understanding result , medication adherence , overall satisfaction delivery model ) . In PGx arm , pharmacist offer PGx test patient prescribe one 10 eligible drug ( aripiprazole , carisoprodol , celecoxib , citalopram , clopidogrel , metoprolol , nortriptyline , paroxetine , simvastatin , warfarin ) return result patient physician recommendation drug dosage change base result . In PGx MTM arm , pharmacist offer PGx test patient prescribe one 10 eligible drug provide two MTM session : one time testing , one result return . All patient survey PGx test 3 month receive result . Pharmacists survey prior participation follow conclusion study . Pharmacists also conduct chart review patient document interaction enrol patient provider .
DOC.criteria: Pharmacist participant must community pharmacist license practice North Carolina Patient participant must prescribe one 10 eligible medication ( aripiprazole , carisoprodol , celecoxib , citalopram , clopidogrel , metoprolol , nortriptyline , paroxetine , simvastatin , warfarin ) Patient participant must able consent participate testing , able read English Patients previously undergone pharmacogenetic test eligible .
